question: Who was the alumni that taught at the school first, served as a tea server in 1925, had three paintings at the George Eastman hall of RIT, and also did the wall in Gosnell?<image 1>
description: The image depicts an abstract painting featuring a series of nested squares. The outermost square is light blue, followed by a gray square, then a white square, and finally a yellow square at the center. The composition is simple yet striking, with clean lines and solid colors. This style is reminiscent of the work of Josef Albers, a renowned artist and educator known for his contributions to color theory and geometric abstraction.
